message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper proposes a novel method for language modeling that combines a neural topic model with a mixture-of-experts language model. As such, it could fit into several arXiv CS sub-categories. 

cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely category, as the paper deals directly with language modeling. 

cs.LG (Machine Learning) is also a likely category, as the paper uses neural networks to learn the language model. 

cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is another possible category, as the paper deals with natural language processing, which is a common application of AI. 

cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is a less likely category, but still possible, as the paper deals with modeling the semantic coherence of a document, which could be useful for information retrieval tasks. 

cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is also a less likely category, but possible, as the paper uses neural networks to learn the language model.
